clinical_study.brief_title: The Neutrophil-to-Lymphocyte Ratio to Exclude Pancreatic Fistula
clinical_study.official_title: The Neutrophil-to-Lymphocyte Ratio at Post-operative Day 3: a Simple Tool to Exclude Clinically Relevant Postoperative Pancreatic Fistula After Pancreatoduodenectomy

brief_summary.textblock: There is still no consensus on whether drain fluid amylase (DFA) level, C-reactive protein (CRP) level, or complex scores predict clinically relevant postoperative pancreatic fistula (CR-POPF). The aim of this study is to determine the accuracy of simple biochemical parameters (leucocytes, neutrophils, lymphocytes, Neutrophil to Lymphocytes Ratio (NLR), at postoperative days 1 and 3) to exclude the diagnosis of CR-POPF.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of clinically relevant pancreatic fistula
primary_outcome.time_frame: at hospital discharge assessed up to 30 days
primary_outcome.description: Clinically relevant postoperative pancreatic fistula according to the 2016 International Study Group of Pancreatic Surgery definition

secondary_outcome.description: Identification of biological markers to exclude clinically relevant postoperative pancreatic fistula

intervention.description: A pancreaticogastrostomy or -jejunostomy duct-to-mucosa was achieved according to the surgeon's preference and pancreatic texture.

study_pop.textblock: 3 cohorts, which were as follows: the set of 451 patients was randomly sampled following a ratio 2:1 into a training (n=301) and a validation (n=150) cohort to respectively determine and validate the accuracy, best timing, and cut-off for the surrogate markers, then validated in an external cohort (n=197).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who underwent pancreatoduodenectomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Total pancreatectomy
- Enucleation
